content.rendered:
24Fashion TV Exclusive: Kentaro Kameyama, the designer, presented about 14 new looks consisting of black silk minimalistic dresses, casual oversized sweats, and dramatic white & black long dresses for his SS22 collection. Winner of season 16 of Project Runway, he blew guests away with a strong narrative in his predominantly black and white collection. Structure ruled the wearable-art designs with thick fridge elements.

About: Kentaro Kameyama Japanese-born angeleno Kentaro Kameyama is a member of fashions in crowd as the winner of season 16 of lifetimes Emmy-nominated series Project Runway. Kameyama clinched the coveted prize with his jaw-dropping runway show at New Yorks fashion week, which featured models wearing expertly-tailored clothes inspired by classical music, walking to an original score composed by Kameyama. The fashion-forward collection impressed the shows judges Heidi Klum, Nina Garcia, Zac Posen and the years finale guest judge, Jessica Alba. Designer: Kentaro Kameyama

Watch the full show for FREE on 24FashionTV channel on ROKU TV or Amazon Fire TV

Photo by Liza Kushnir exclusively for 24Fashion TV

LAFW powered by Art Hearts Fashion
